newsitem.title: SPAIN: Mannesmann said in talks with Endesa on Retevision.
newsitem.headline: Mannesmann said in talks with Endesa on Retevision.

text.p: Mannesmann is in talks with Endesa and Italy's Stet for a possible cooperation on Spain's second basic telephone operator Retevision, sources at the German telecoms firm told Reuters.
"We are talking to Endesa and Stet to study cooperation possibilities if their (consortium) should win the Retevision auction," the source said.
However sources at the Endesa consortium said on Thursday they had received no formal communication of Mannesman's interest.
"There may have been informal contacts before the offer on Monday, but there has been nothing at an institutional level," the source said.
Mannesmann had decided not to bid for Retevision as it did not have sufficient time to present its own offer after being surprised by a change of partners at Telefonica in April.
"We thought that British Telecom would bid for Spain's second licence, but after its alliance with Telefonica, everything changed," the Mannesmann source said.

Endesa-Stet's bid for Retevision, announced on Monday, was 116.36 billion pesetas, while Opera, comprising Spain's BCH, France Telecom and U.S.-based Sprint, had offered just 84 billion pesetas for the initial 60 percent privatisation of Retevision.
Analysts expect the Endesa group to win the auction.
